text: LTipu Sultan (1 December 1751 â€“ 4 May 1799), is also known as the mysoor, was the ruler of the Mysore from 1782 to 1799. He was also a scholar, soldier and poet. Tipu was the eldest son of Sultan Hyder Ali and his wife Fathima Fakhr- un-Nisa. Tipu Sultan was born in Devanahalli in 1751. The birthplace of Tipu Sultan, located very close to the Devanahalli Fort is just a small pillared closed place with a stone tablet which declares the place to be the birthplace of Tipu Sultan. The area around the place is known as Khas Bagh. Category:1751 births Category:1799 deaths Category:Indian monarchs Category:Indian poets
title: Fathima Fakhr-un-Nisar
